snippet: The owner of the Atlanta Hawks approached team executives with his thoughts about how to attract more white fans.
abstract: Atlanta Hawks owner Bruce Levenson informs NBA Commissioner Adam Silver that he intends to sell team, cutting short investigation into racially charged email; Levenson sent email two years earlier to fellow Hawks executives detailing his thoughts on how team could attract more white fans; situation is yet another embarrassment for the NBA, following conflict surrounding anti-black statements by former Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling.

byline.contributor: Billy Witz contributed reporting from Los Angeles, and Mike Tierney from Atlanta.

lead_paragraph: The owner of the Atlanta Hawks approached team executives with his thoughts about how to attract more white fans.

headline.seo: Bruce Levenson Will Sell Atlanta Hawks After Racially Charged Email Is Revealed
headline.main: Views on Race Again Prompt an N.B.A. Sale
headline.print_headline: Views on Race Again Prompt an N.B.A. Sale
